inclusion.criterion: history of thrombosis related to pregnancy or oral contraceptive use
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: history of thrombosis accompanied by an underlying thrombophilia other than homozygous for the factor V Leiden mutation, heterozygous for both the factor V Leiden and the prothrombin G20210A mutation, or AT-III deficiency
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: without a history of thrombosis but who have an underlying thrombophilia and a strong family history of thrombosis
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Known thrombophilia except for those listed above, with a history of adverse pregnancy outcome (APO) as defined by: ≥3 pregnancy losses in the 1st trimester, ≥2 pregnancy losses/stillbirth in 2nd trimester, ≥1 pregnancy loss/intrauterine fetal demise (IUFD) in the 3rd trimester, intrauterine growth restriction (IUGR), abruptio placentae, or severe pre-Eclampsia prior to 34 weeks gestation.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Warrants prophylaxis against venous thromboembolism in pregnancy according to American College of Obstetrics and Gynecology Practice Bulletin 2000, reaffirmed in 2008:
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Need for therapeutic-level anticoagulation as determined by physician
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Renal disease as defined by serum creatinine >1.0
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient has a history of severe 'exploding' headache and abnormal vasculature with a draining vein from L temporal lobe penetrating deep white matter consistent with AVM. She was discharged home with her husband on [**2155-12-6**].
